issue.message: Don't include `android.R` here; use a fully qualified name for each usage instead
By convention, the custom view (`AbsActionBarView`) and the declare-styleable (`ActionBar`) should have the same name (various editor features rely on this convention)

By convention, the declare-styleable (`ActionBarLayout`) for a layout parameter class (`LayoutParams`) is expected to be the surrounding class (`ActionBar`) plus "`_Layout`", e.g. `ActionBar_Layout`. (Various editor features rely on this convention.)
By convention, the custom view (`ActionBarContainer`) and the declare-styleable (`ActionBar`) should have the same name (various editor features rely on this convention)
By convention, the custom view (`DialogTitle`) and the declare-styleable (`TextAppearance`) should have the same name (various editor features rely on this convention)
